definitions: A naturally occurring acyclic monoterpene, a hydrocarbon, found in the essential oils of various plants, including bay, cannabis, hops, and thyme.
An organic compound that is a precursor to other terpenes and is used in the fragrance industry.
examples: Myrcene contributes to the aroma of mangoes.
The essential oil was rich in Myrcene.
Chemists synthesized Myrcene in the lab.
